item.title: Rune Slayer: All Ore Locations
item.description:
Creating a powerful build in Rune Slayer requires finding rare equipment. You donâ€™t have to search for ready-made gear as you can craft it yourself, although this requires a lot of different Ores.

Ores are the main crafting resources in this Roblox RPG. This is especially true for the rarest Mithril ore. However, you cannot simply mine ore, as you will need to have special tools of the appropriate tier.

How to Get Ore in Rune Slayer

During the tutorial in Rune Slayer , you will be taught how to get wood and even given the appropriate tool. Fortunately, with other resources in the game, everything works the same. In the case of Ore in Rune Slayer , you need to get a Pickaxe to mine it.

Players can purchase the first Pickaxe by visiting the Blacksmith's shop. The Cooper Pickaxe is suitable for common Ores, while rarer ones require better tools. You can craft them from the found ore.

However, it is not enough to just get a Pickaxe, since you also need to find the locations where Ore spawns in Rune Slayer . It is worth noting that some of these locations are quite dangerous due to the many enemies. But to make it easier for you to craft gear for your character, we have compiled a list of all the Ore locations in Rune Slayer .

All Rune Slayer Ores and Locations

Ore Location
Copper Players can mine Copper Ore in the Slime Cave. The entrance can be found north of the Mandrake Field.
Iron Players can also mine Iron Ore in the Slime Cave. You can also visit the small caves around the Wayshrine location to find extra Iron Ore.
Silver Greatwood Forest Cave and Spider Cave. All you have to do is get to the swamp shore in Greatwood Forest and examine the rocks around to find the entrance to the cave with Silver.
Platinum To mine Platinum Ore, you need to visit the Bahlgar location.
Mithril For the rarest Ore, players will have to go down into the depths of Balgaron Chasm. But be careful since this is an endgame location and the enemies there are extremely strong.
Gold Unlike other Ores, Gold cannot be mined directly. Instead, it drops with a small chance while mining Platinum and Mithril.

item.title: Soulslike Games With The Steepest Learning Curve, Ranked
item.description:
For the uninitiated, every Soulslike feels like a steep learning curve defines it, but those in the know are well aware that there's a wide spectrum of Soulslike difficulty. Some of the most difficult can give even diehard fans a lot of trouble. More than "git gud," these games demand expertise.

Whether it's a host of interlocking game systems that require careful attention and planning or rhythm-game-like precision that requires absolute perfection, some Soulslikes just hit differently when it comes to their massive learning curves.

8 Elden Ring

Foolish Ambitions

Though in many ways Elden Ring, may be one of the most welcoming Soulslike games to newcomers, the sheer scale of the game is absolutely daunting. For Soulslike fans, its systems are pretty familiar, but for newcomers, it's overwhelming.

New players need to learn not just about items, but also about talismans, weapons, the control scheme, the open-world mechanics, the levelling builds, the weapon styles, damage types, the vast boss list, and countless other considerations. It demands a lot from the uninitiated.

7 Dead Cells

Head On Fire

The world of Dead Cells seems like a pretty cut-and-dry 2D soulslike at first, but its difficulty becomes clear pretty fast. Mixing the roguelike with the Soulslike, Dead Cells demands mastery of its combat, navigation, and RPG systems if a newcomer has any chance of succeeding.

The difficulty comes not just from mastering those systems, but figuring out how to survive the game's brutal combat difficulty. A single mistake in Dead Cells can mean hours of progress lost, so the player's knowledge of builds, items, abilities, and map knowledge need to be perfect. This one's demanding, but a lot of fun once the difficulty curve is surmounted.

6 Salt and Sanctuary

Salt in the Wound

As one of the first attempts to take the soulslike formula into the space of the 2D platformer, Salt and Sanctuary deserves credit for figuring out the tricky details of translating the brutal combat soulslikes are known for. However, it's not easier in the 2D world, and is instead perhaps even more difficult.

While the game's systems aren't too hard to parse, Salt and Sanctuary never holds back when it comes to difficulty. Players need to have lightning-fast reaction times, a good understanding of their build, and the ability to stay calm under pressure as the oppressive world of the game bears down.

5 Dark Souls

Hollow Undead

Granted, for seasoned Soulslike fans, the learning curve of the original Dark Souls isn't too steep these days. But imagine what it was like for the original players and the level of obliqueness in every aspect of the game's design and the many mechanics that aren't tutorialized. It's tough.

To get through Dark Souls , a newcomer either needs determination far greater than most, or a guide to help them along and answer the many inevitable questions that will arise. After all, even understanding the class system out of the gate is pretty challenging with no previous experience of a FromSoftware game. However, by surmounting that hurdle, players have a chance to play one of the greatest games ever made.

4 Lies of P

Long Nosed Liar

Despite its unique aesthetic, Lies of P was released in an environment where high-budget Soulslikes were emerging fast, with big competition from the likes of The Surge. Lies of P emerged from a relatively unknown studio, raising eyebrows further. Despite all that, Lies of P became a smash hit and showed just how much pull the Soulslike genre has outside of FromSoftware.

The game design of Lies of P is inspired by the fast, aggressive combat of Bloodborne, where being defensive means timing tight parry windows, with no credible armor or shields that can tank more than a few hits from the game's fearsome roster of bosses. Learning means getting better at parries and dodges, which can be a tough mountain to surmount.

3 Nioh 2

Sengoku Slasher

The original Nioh was one of the first big releases in the soulslike genre, and it showed just how credible competitors could be to FromSoftware. Nioh 2 cemented that reputation. It's perhaps no surprise that Team Ninja, the folks behind the infamously difficult Ninja Gaiden , were the ones to do it.

In Nioh 2 , players not only have to worry about parries, dodges, defensive, and attack patterns, but also a massive laundry list of stances, weapons, abilities, and more, each of which needs to be employed carefully in time-sensitive situations with hyper-aggressive enemies. It's a tough road, but a great and underplayed competitor to its FromSoftware brethren.

2 Bloodborne

Fear The Old Blood

As FromSoftware's clout began to rise in the 2010s, many wondered whether the Souls formula would survive the Dark Souls franchise itself. FromSoftware was miles ahead of the speculation. With the release of Bloodborne in 2015, it demonstrated that Dark Souls was no accident, and that the formula could be iterated into ever more punishing forms.

That's because Bloodborne actively attempted to move away from the defensive playstyle defined by a big suit of armor and a shield encouraged in Dark Souls . Instead, unmitigated aggression against the game's horrific bosses is the path to success in Bloodborne , which takes a long time to dial in just right, resulting in some of the hardest bosses FromSoftware has ever made.

1 Sekiro

Samurai Master

Sekiro: Shadows Die Twice is the undeniable black sheep of the FromSoftware output post -Demon's Souls . While it still iterates on the central formula, Sekiro is much more restrictive regarding how to play it well. If the player can't master the parry system, they're going to be in a lot of trouble, and even the game's combat arts can't help.

There is no flexibility afforded to players here. Either a player figures out how to do the parry timings fast, or they will be stuck at an early gating boss for the foreseeable future. For some, that's exactly what makes the game so great, because its design is incredibly intentional, but it's hard to deny that the learning curve is incredibly steep.

item.title: 7 Post-Apocalyptic Games with Unique Settings
item.description:
Summary

  • Games set in post-apocalyptic worlds elevate player experience with unique atmospheres and great mechanics.
  • Rain World offers a unique survival experience with a simulated ecosystem full of dangers and tools.
  • Metro Exodus features immersive FPS mechanics with dangers like toxic gas and an open-world narrative.

Games set in post-apocalyptic worlds are always very interesting to explore, as they offer players a hopeless atmosphere that elevates the experience greatly and raises the stakes. While some developers choose to focus these kinds of games towards horror, others prefer to take on a different approach and instead turn their attention to developing great game mechanics.

Many post-apocalyptic games are extremely realistic and give players a sensation of immersion that can be quite entertaining, but often daunting as well. Typically, these games shine thanks to their environments, as theyâ€™re quite different from anything else available. Here are some of the best post-apocalyptic games with unique settings .

7 Rain World

Beautiful Art Style And Unique Gameplay

  • Players can use several elements for survival
  • The world's design is unique and bleak

Although the reviews for Rain World thus far have been mixed, it's hard to argue against the statement that it offers quite a unique experience to players. This title features a simulated ecosystem full of different elements players can use and dangers they must escape.

This 2D world has been carefully designed to give players the tools they need to survive, without spoon-feeding anything to them and keeping the experience challenging enough to make it interesting. The worldâ€™s design is quite unique and works well with the overall atmosphere presented.

6 Metro Exodus

The Locomotive Aurora Is The Last Safe Haven On Earth

  • Artyom and his companions travel through a post-apocalyptic wasteland
  • Toxic gas is just one of the many dangers awaiting players during their journey

Metro Exodus is the third installment in the Metro video game series. It is based on the novels by Dmitry Glukhovsky and tells a story of the struggle for survival as protagonist Artyom and his companions try to travel through Russia and Kazakhstan aboard the locomotive Aurora.

This title features great FPS mechanics that allow for fast-paced action throughout the post-apocalyptic world itâ€™s set in. In some areas, the air is toxic, which requires the use of a gas mask so as to stay protected and avoid poisoning. Those who want to elevate their experience even further will want to try some of the best mods available for the game.

5 Death Stranding

Sam Porter Bridges Must Ensure The Survival Of Humanity And Its Colonies

  • A cataclysmic event released dangerous creatures on Earth
  • Humanity endures through various colonies

The plot of Death Stranding is rather simple, as it focuses on a post-apocalyptic version of the United States that resulted from a cataclysmic event that released dangerous creatures onto the population. As humanity does, those who survived formed colonies across the land, which must remain connected in one way or another and stocked with enough supplies for everyone.

Players will take on the role of Sam Porter Bridges (portrayed by Norman Reedus), as he travels around and delivers supplies to the surviving colonies to prevent the extinction of humanity. Death Stranding was critically acclaimed, but there are some characters that many players agree should not return for the sequel.

4 Frostpunk

A Post-Apocalyptic Setting That Stays In The Past Rather Than Exploring The Future

  • The game is set during a volcanic winter in the late-19th century
  • Gathering and managing resources is critical to the experience

One of the things that makes Frostpunk so interesting is that, as opposed to other post-apocalyptic titles, it's not set in the present or the future, but rather in an alternate version of the late 19th century. Players will take on the role of a leader who must ensure the maintenance and construction of a city during a grim volcanic winter.

Gathering and managing resources is a key component of this child's experience, and so is making tough choices regarding survival and the allocation of said resources. Frostpunk offers various scenarios, some of which are ideal under the circumstances, and others, not so much.

3 Horizon Zero Dawn

Humanity's Hubris Brought About The Downfall Of Society

  • Aloy must survive in a dangerous version of Earth
  • Great graphics, fun combat mechanics, and an interesting story

Horizon Zero Dawn follows the story of Aloy as she makes her way through a post-apocalyptic version of Earth where mechanical creatures roam free. This title has a ton of lore that fans of the franchise will definitely want to read before their next playthrough, as it provides a clear explanation for the condition they find Aloyâ€™s world in.

Horizon Zero Dawn not only features outstanding combat mechanics and a compelling narrative, but it also has great graphics. This, along with many other aspects, makes it one of the best PlayStation games of the 2010s.

2 NieR: Automata

2B and 9S Must Survive The Dangers That Await Them Along Their Journey

  • The game follows combat android 2B and scanner android 9S
  • Fun, fast-paced combat mechanics

Set during a proxy war between alien-crafted machines and human-made androids, NieR: Automata follows the story of combat android 2B and scanner android 9S as they fight various enemies and make their way through a post-apocalyptic world.

This title features fast-paced combat mechanics that will require players to stay on their toes and develop cat-like reflexes if they mean to defeat their enemies and avoid the attacks directed at them. Players can chain different attacks to maximize the damage they deal and ensure that their enemies go down before they do. NieR: Automata is, without a doubt, one of the best titles in the NieR and Drakengard franchises.

1 Fallout 4

The Boston Commonwealth Is Beautifully Crafted

  • Retrofuturistic concept that works amazingly well with the game's theme
  • Various weapons and NPCs that make the experience very enjoyable

At the time of writing this article, it's quite hard to find a player who has not heard of Fallout 4 or any other title in the Fallout franchise, as it has become increasingly popular throughout the years. Fallout 4 â€™s story focuses on the Sole Survivor as they explore the Boston Commonwealth and take on the various dangers awaiting them.

One of the things that makes the gameplay so great, is that as players explore the post-nuclear wasteland the game is set in, they can listen to classics from the real-world 1950s-1960s, which greatly complements the retrofuturistic atmosphere of this title. Those whoâ€™ve already completed the game once will find that there are many interesting ways to shake up a second playthrough.

item.title: Monopoly GO: All Tycoon Pass Rewards for Tycoon Club
item.description:
Quick Links

  • All Tycoon Pass Rewards in Monopoly GOâ€™s Tycoon Club
  • How To Progress On The Tycoon Pass Milestone Track in Monopoly GO
  • Best Way To Spend Loyalty Points in Monopoly GO

Monopoly GO â€™s Tycoon Club, a premium rewards program, is now expanding its membership and offers exclusive benefits like spinning a Daily Wheel and redeeming Loyalty Points for exciting rewards. The Tycoon Club features a unique progression system called the Tycoon Pass , where members can earn rewards by spending Loyalty Points.

The Tycoon Pass functions similarly to a season pass system, offering members a series of rewards that can be unlocked by hitting the necessary milestones. Read on to learn all about the Tycoon Pass Rewards in Monopoly GO â€™s Tycoon Club and how to progress on the milestone track.

Updated by Usama Ali on March 6, 2025 : Monopoly GOâ€™s Tycoon Pass has reset again, giving players a new season of exclusive rewards to grab. Tycoon Pass rewards can only be earned by spending Loyalty Points. These points are gained through purchases made in the Tycoon Club with real money. As always, each season introduces a fresh set of rewards, including a unique, limited-edition board token that canâ€™t be claimed elsewhere. This guide has now been updated with details of the latest Tycoon Pass season in Monopoly GO and lists down all the exciting rewards waiting for dedicated players who invest in the Tycoon Club.

All Tycoon Pass Rewards in Monopoly GOâ€™s Tycoon Club

The Tycoon Pass in Monopoly GO gives you the chance to win special rewards you can't get anywhere else. To get these rewards, you need to earn "Loyalty Points" by buying things from the Tycoon Club store using Diamonds in Monopoly GO .

Currently, there are seven milestones in this seasonâ€™s Tycoon Pass. You can hit the first milestone by spending 300 Diamonds in the Tycoon Club store. Buy things like sticker packs, safes, or reward bundles to hit all the milestones in the Tycoon Pass.

Hereâ€™s a breakdown of all the rewards you can unlock this season:

Milestone

Rewards

#1

25 Dice Rolls, Yellow Sticker Pack

#2

100 Dice Rolls, Cash, Pink Sticker Pack

#3

250 Dice Rolls, Cash, Pink Sticker Pack

#4

750 Dice Rolls, Cash, Blue Sticker Pack

#5

1,500 Dice Rolls, Cash, Swap Pack

#6

Mr. Monopolyâ€™s Cat board token

#7

Wild Sticker

How To Progress On The Tycoon Pass Milestone Track in Monopoly GO

Unlike traditional progression systems where you can spend points directly on the track, the Tycoon Pass works a bit differently. To progress on the Tycoon Pass Milestone track, you need to spend Loyalty Points. Every Loyalty Point spent on benefits in the Tycoon Club (like exclusive reward bundles, cosmetic items, and other perks) contributes to your Tycoon Pass progress.

The more you spend Loyalty Points on benefits, the faster you'll progress and the more rewards you'll earn. You can monitor your progress to see how close you are to reaching the next milestone. Whenever you reach a milestone, youâ€™ll receive a reward directly in their game, ready to grab it right away.

Since Tycoon Pass is active for a specific time, each milestone track is time-limited. When a new Tycoon Pass starts, the Loyalty Points stored on the track will be reset to zero, and you'll need to start spending points again to progress.

Best Way To Spend Loyalty Points in Monopoly GO

The best way to spend Loyalty Points in the Tycoon Club is to invest in Reward Bundles . Each bundle contains a specific set of rewards, like dice, cash, and flash boosters. Choose the ones that offer the most value and align with your playing style. You can get Loyalty Points by purchasing items from the Tycoon Club Store.

item.title: NYTs Strands Hints, Tips, and Answers for Today, March 7, 2025
item.description:
The New York Times Strands puzzle is a fresh twist on the classic word search, blending familiar mechanics with a thematic layer that adds depth. Each puzzle presents a grid of letters hiding a set of words connected by a common theme. While it can be satisfying to uncover the words on your own, some puzzles may leave you stumped.

Whether you know how to play Strands well or are a newbie, having a few hints in your back pocket can make the experience smoother and more enjoyable. This guide offers tips, clues, and answers to help you tackle the puzzle.

The NYT Games Strands All Decked Out #369 March 7, 2025

The Strands puzzle for today has the clue All Decked Out . It has seven things to find: the Spangram and six themed words.

NYT Strands Spangram Tips and Theme Hints

Searching for some hints that don't ruin any of the words like the in-game hints do? You can find several hints in the sections below to help you without spoiling any of the words in this relaxing puzzle game.

General Spangram Hint 1

General Spangram Hint 2

General Spangram Hint 3

Spoilers for Today's New York Times Strands

In order to get any spoilers in-game, you have to look for non-themed words and save up for them. If you don't feel like doing that, you can find spoilers in each of the two sections below instead.

Spoiler 1

Spoiler 2

The Answer to the NYT All Decked Out Strands

The complete spoiler for today's puzzle is in the expandable section below. If you open it up, you will see all the themed words and the Spangram along with a screenshot of where to put all those words in this puzzle game.

Today's Strands Explained

Don't get this challenging puzzle game's answer? In the section below is a breakdown of how the clue, the theme, and all the answer words fit together and make sense in today's puzzle.

Want to play? Check out the New York Times Games Strands website available on almost any device with a browser.
